content: the little knit clementines are the perfect citrus-y solution for using up scraps of leftover sock yarn you know the little pieces that are too small to do anything else with knit with eyes and legs for cute little clementine friends or leave them off for cute decorations this pattern is also available for free on my blog 1 **size** the finished clementine is approximately approx 18cm / 7 25 around at the widest point and 5 5cm / 2 25 tall not including the optional legs **yarn and yardage** the clementines use fingering weight sock yarn and ~10 yards for c1 orange 5 yards for c2 green and 5 yards for c3 brown optional sock yarn with nylon or silk or a high twist is preferred as it will be more durable black embroidery thread or scraps of black fingering weight yarn is also needed if working the eyes **needles and gauge** us 1 / 2 5mm or size needed to achieve a tight fabric exact gauge isn t important for this pattern but the fabric should be tight enough not to show stuffing i find for most yarn us 0 / 2 0mm or us 1 / 2 25mm is the best choice **notions** knitting needles for knitting flat and in the round darning needle polyfill for stuffing and black embroidery thread or scrap pieces of fingering weight yarn for eyes optional > join my newsletter 2 to hear about new patterns and blog posts and get access to exclusive discounts 1 https //www classicsongbird ca/blog/free-knitting-pattern-little-knit-clementines 2 https //www classicsongbird ca/knitters-newsletter
